page.title: 01Overview:Block GR03640588
page.content: The greater part of this "D-block" is covered by the dark and deep waters of the Kielder Reservoir. On its shores are found the plantations of the Forestry Commission, broken only by the rough grazing land around{Rushy {Knowe. }The new road, built when the reservoir flooded the North Tyne Valley above Yarrow, runs through the western part of the "D-Block". Along the western and southern banks of the Kielder Reservoir, several activity centres have been set up, mainly catering for a variety of{water {sports. }One of the most impressive of these is the{Hawkhirst Adventure Camp} which is to be found at GR36585893. The eastern and northern sides of the reservoir are known as the "Wild Country",with no tourist developments being undertaken there.
